title: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, January 27, 2014
byline: David Weinberg, Stacey Vanek Smith, Blake Farmer, Amy Scott, John Sudworth, Bruce Johnson, David Stern, D Gorenstein and Lizzie O'Leary
teaser: It's a sea of red, red, and more red if you're looking out at emerging markets this morning, with numbers like -2 percent. What's going on? Just over 3 years ago, a Tunisian street vendor set himself on fire, kicking off the Arab Spring. Much of the revolution had its roots in economic instability. This weekend, Tunisia adopted a new, more progressive constitution. We take a look at the economic challenges it's still facing as it rebuilds. And, coffee prices are at a 6 and a half year low. Great news for coffee lovers, right? Well, maybe not.
